objects.name: Direction
objects.string:
[Enter] Toogle colorization
[R] randomize colors
[Space] go to the next scene

events.comment:
The colors need to be reset to their initial values first because the effect of the "recolorize" action adds up.
This allows to change several colors of an object.
Randomize colors

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: jeremy.leriche22@gmail.com
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allows you to create a random color.
To use it, go in the text area to set a color and type `RandomColor::CreateRandomColor()`.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RandomColor
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create a random color for a scene, an object, or any other color input.

eventsFunctions.description: Create a totally random color.
eventsFunctions.name: CreateRandomColor

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Draws a draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
The value range, tick spacing, and the appearance of the slider can be defined with properties.

How to use:
- Add this behavior a **Shape Painter** object
- Place an instance of that shape painter on the screen where you want the slider to appear
- Use the "Value" expression to find the Value based on the position of the slider

Tips:
- You can disable the slider to prevent a user from interacting with it
- You can set the Value of the slider and the slider will move to the correct position

Further details can be found in [this tutorial video](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs).

Breaking changes (1.0.0)
- Track thickness and length properties replaced track width and height. These 2 properties must be set again if they were different from the default size.
- Hidden sliders can be dragged. The "enable" action must be used to disable them.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggableSliderControl

events.comment: Make sure object doesn't get re-drawn every frame
Use correct min value (instead of always starting at 0)
Set track height function (which enforces valid thumb sizes)
Start halo at same size as thumb
Track where the mouse is (in relation to object)
Move slider when being dragged
End sliding and update variables
Update "Value" based on the location of the thumb
Grow halo even more when pressed
Detect hover/touch/click (but only if the layer and object is visible, and the object is not already being dragged)
Detect mouse clicks near track, start dragging
Reset hover detection
Grow halo when hovered
Shrink halo to zero when not hovered
Redraw slider only when halo is not at final size
Set inactive track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw inactive track
Draw half circle at end of track (inactive side)
Set active track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw active track (2 pixels bigger than property)
Draw half circle at end of track (active side)
Prepare halo
Draw halo (it will grow or shrink as needed)
Use a more opaque halo while being dragged (it will grow or shrink as needed)
Prepare thumb settings
Draw Circle thumb
Draw Rectangle thumb

eventsFunctions.description: Enable or disable the slider. Users cannot interact while it is disabled.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Add00, AlanPH, Tristan (Victris Games)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Expressions to convert color values between various formats (RGB, HSV, HSL, named colors) and get colors between 2 others.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ColorConversion
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Expressions to convert color values between various formats (RGB, HSV, HSL, named colors) and get colors between 2 others.

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a hexadecimal string into a RGB string.  Example input: "0459AF".
eventsFunctions.name: HexToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Apply a weighted mean between 2 RGB colors.
eventsFunctions.name: RgbMean

parameters.longDescription: 0 gives the first color, 1 gives the second color
parameters.name: Ratio

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a hexadecimal string.  Example input: "0;128;255".
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHex

eventsFunctions.description: Return the hue for a RGB string.  Example input: "0;128;255"".
eventsFunctions.name: Hue

eventsFunctions.description: Return the saturation for a RGB string.  Example input: "0;128;255"".
eventsFunctions.name: Saturation

eventsFunctions.description: Return the lightness for a RGB string.  Example input: "0;128;255"".
eventsFunctions.name: Lightness

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a HSL string.  Example input: "0;128;255"".
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHsl

eventsFunctions.description: Converts HSV color values into a RGB string.  Valid input ranges:  H(0 to 360), S(0 to 100), V(0 to 100).
eventsFunctions.name: HsvToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a HSV string.  Example input: "0;128;255".
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHsv

eventsFunctions.description:
Converts a color name into a RGB string.  (Examples: black, gray, white, red, purple, green, yellow, blue)  
Full list of colors: https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp.
eventsFunctions.name: NameToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Converts HSL color values into a RGB string.  Valid input ranges:  H(0 to 360), S(0 to 100), L(0 to 100).
eventsFunctions.name: HslToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a color hue (range: 0 to 360) into an RGB color string with 100% saturation and 50% lightness.
eventsFunctions.name: HueToRgb

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension allows to restyle a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.

It can be used to:
- Change the color of player short according to its team color.
- Add small color variation to trees of a forest.
- Restyle objects to match other assets.

This extension is experimental and might no longer work in future version of GDevelop.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Recolorizer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Independently change the colors of a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.

eventsFunctions.description: Define JavaScript classes.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineJavaScript

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Independently change the colors of a sprite.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SpriteRecolorizer

eventsFunctions.description: Replace a given color of an object with another one. The scope allows to change similar colors at once.
eventsFunctions.name: Recolorize
eventsFunctions.sentence: Recolorize _PARAM0_ from color _PARAM2_ to color _PARAM3_ within a scope of  hue: _PARAM4_ saturation: _PARAM5_% lightness: _PARAM6_%

eventsFunctions.description: Set back the original colors of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetColor

events.comment: Unsure that destroyed instance recolorization can be free.
